intro: Botrychium virginianum var. americanum, commonly known as the American moonwort, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Ophioglossaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped sporangia that are clustered in a rosette formation on the underside of its leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short, unbranched stem with a single pair of opposite, pinnately divided leaves. Botrychium virginianum var. americanum is a rare and endangered species found primarily in the eastern United States.
